entry.et: Middle English wast; probably akin to Old English wæstm growth, weaxan to grow wax

def.dt: :the typically narrowed part of the body between the thorax and hips
:the greatly constricted basal part of the abdomen of some insects (as wasps and flies)
:the part of something corresponding to or resembling the human waist: as
:the part of a ship's deck between the poop and forecastle
:the middle part of a sailing ship between foremast and mainmast
:the middle section of the fuselage of an airplane
:a garment or the part of a garment covering the body from the neck to the waistline or just below:
